member.name: T:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_DispatcherQueueHandler
member.summary: A class that allows to queue an Action so that it is executed in a Dispatcher.Invoke call, but only if another action is not already pending execution. This is useful for example to redraw the screen when a collection of item changes, doing so only once if the collection changes multiple times. Another example is redrawing an element when any of its properties change, while ensuring that if many properties are changed, the element is redrawn only once.

member.name: M:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_DispatcherQueueHandler.QueueActionIfQueueIsEmpty(System.Action)
member.summary: Call this method to perform the specified action in a Dispatcher.Invoke call, but only if another action is not already pending execution. This is useful for example to redraw the screen when a collection of item changes, doing so only once if the collection changes multiple times. Another example is redrawing an element when any of its properties change, while ensuring that if many properties are changed, the element is redrawn only once.
member.param: The action to queue

member.name: F:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_PropertyStorage._actualValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the computed value that has the highest priority among the style, animation, visual state, inherited, etc. values.

member.name: P:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_PropertyStorage.ActualValueIsDirty
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ActualValue needs to be recomputer because it is no longer correct.

member.name: M:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_SimulatorExecuteJavaScript.ExecuteJavaScriptSync(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes JavaScript code immediately. This also forces all the pending async JS code to be executed (flush).
member.param: The JS code to execute.
Some optional comments to write to the log of JS calls.

member.name: M:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_SimulatorExecuteJavaScript.ExecuteJavaScriptAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Postpone the executes of the JavaScript code to until a JavaScript execution "with return value" is made, or when the process is idle. This enables to significantly improve performance in the Simulator.
member.param: The JS code to execute.
Some optional comments to write to the log of JS calls.

member.name: M:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_UriHelper.ConvertToHtml5Path(System.String,Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Converts to an URI suitable to use in the HTML5 "src" property.
member.param: The URI with the C#/XAML syntax.

This is an optional parameter that is helpful in case of relative URI's. In fact, when an URI is relative, we need to transform it into an absolute URI in order to locate the resources. A relative URI is usually relative to the place where the .XAML file is located. For example, when using an Image control, relative image paths are relative to the location of the .XAML file that contains the Image control.
member.returns: The URI suitable to use in the HTML5 "src" property

member.summary: namespace.

member.summary: Raises the event
member.param: The javascript event argument.

member.name: M:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_DispatcherHelpers.QueueAction(System.Action)
member.summary: This will add the action to a list of actions to perform at once in a Dispatcher.Invoke call. This has better performance than calling Dispatcher.BeginInvoke directly, because all the queued actions are performed together in a single Dispatch.BeginInvoke call.
member.param: The action to queue.

member.name: M:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_FontsHelper.LoadFont(System.String,Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Creates a css style with @font-face for the given font, then returns the name to use as the font-family. This name is actually the relative path to the file containing the font.
member.param: The path to the font.

This is an optional parameter that is helpful in case of relative URI's. In fact, when an URI is relative, we need to transform it into an absolute URI in order to locate the resources. A relative URI is usually relative to the place where the .XAML file is located. For example, when using an Image control, relative image paths are relative to the location of the .XAML file that contains the Image control.
member.returns: The name to use to set the font-family property, a.k.a: the relative path to the font.

The Stretch mode to apply on the Shape

member.summary: Gets the multiplicators and offsets to fit the Stretch value.
member.param: The element on which we make the stretch
The thickness of the stroke
the minimal value on the horizontal axis as defined by the user
the maximal value on the horizontal axis as defined by the user
the minimal value on the vertical axis as defined by the user
the minimal value on the vertical axis as defined by the user
the Stretch value to apply

the resulting value by which we have to multiply the vertical coordinates to fit the Stretch value
the offset to apply on horizontal coordinates before applying multiplicators
the offset to apply on vertical coordinates before applying multiplicators
the offset to apply on horizontal coordinates after applying multiplicators
the offset to apply on vertical coordinates after applying multiplicators
the offset to apply on the Left margin of the element to compensate for the negative coordinates in the path

member.name: T:CSHTML5.Internal.INTERNAL_VisibilityChangedNotifier
member.summary: The goal of this class is to allow elements to subscribe to the Visibility_Changed event of any of its ancestors. It is useful for example to work around the fact that drawing on a hidden html canvas (in the XAML "Path" control for example) is not possible, so if a html canvas is hidden, we subscribe to the Visibility_Changed event of its ancestors, so as to refresh it when it becomes visible.

member.summary: Determines whether an element is visible. It can be hidden if any of the ancestors have the "Visibility" property set to "Collapsed".
member.param: UI Element
member.returns: True if the element is visible in the visual tree, false otherwise.

member.summary: Gets the value of the System.String resource localized for the specified culture.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.

The culture for which the resource is localized. Note that if the resource is not localized for this culture, the lookup will fall back using the culture's System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Parent property, stopping after looking in the neutral culture.If this value is null, the System.Globalization.CultureInfo is obtained using the culture's System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture property.
member.returns: The value of the resource localized for the specified culture. If a best match is not possible, null is returned.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.Create(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new System.Xml.XmlReader instance using the specified stream.
member.param: The stream containing the XML data.The System.Xml.XmlReader scans the first bytes of the stream looking for a byte order mark or other sign of encoding. When encoding is determined, the encoding is used to continue reading the stream, and processing continues parsing the input as a stream of (Unicode) characters.
member.returns: An System.Xml.XmlReader object used to read the data contained in the stream.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new System.Xml.XmlReader instance with specified URI.
member.param: The URI for the file containing the XML data. The System.Xml.XmlUrlResolver class is used to convert the path to a canonical data representation.
member.returns: An System.Xml.XmlReader object to read the XML data.

member.summary: Creates a new System.Xml.XmlReader instance with the specified System.IO.TextReader.
member.param: The System.IO.TextReader from which to read the XML data. Because a System.IO.TextReader returns a stream of Unicode characters, the encoding specified in the XML declaration is not used by the System.Xml.XmlReader to decode the data stream.
member.returns: An System.Xml.XmlReader object to read the XML data.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.Create(System.IO.Stream,System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings)
member.summary: Creates a new System.Xml.XmlReader instance with the specified stream and System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings object.
member.param: The stream containing the XML data.The System.Xml.XmlReader scans the first bytes of the stream looking for a byte order mark or other sign of encoding. When encoding is determined, the encoding is used to continue reading the stream, and processing continues parsing the input as a stream of (Unicode) characters.
The System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings object used to configure the new System.Xml.XmlReader instance. This value can be null.
member.returns: An System.Xml.XmlReader object to read the XML data.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.Create(System.String,System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings)
member.summary: Creates a new instance with the specified URI and System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings.
member.param: The URI for the file containing the XML data. The System.Xml.XmlResolver object on the System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings object is used to convert the path to a canonical data representation. If System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings.XmlResolver is null, a new System.Xml.XmlUrlResolver object is used.
The System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings object used to configure the new System.Xml.XmlReader instance. This value can be null.
member.returns: An System.Xml.XmlReader object to read XML data.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The contain types for handling configuration data, such as data in machine or application configuration files. Child namespaces contain types that are used to configure an assembly, to write custom installers for components, and to support a pluggable model for adding functionality to, or removing functionality from, both client and server applications.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespaces contain types that enable you to interact with system processes, event logs, and performance counters. Child namespaces contain types to interact with code analysis tools, to support contracts, to extend design-time support for application monitoring and instrumentation, to log event data using the Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) tracing subsystem, to read to and write from event logs and collect performance data, and to read and write debug symbol information.

member.name: T:System.Globalization.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that define culture-related information, including language, country/region, calendars in use, format patterns for dates, currency, and numbers, and sort order for strings. These classes are useful for writing globalized (internationalized) applications. Classes such as StringInfo and TextInfo provide advanced globalization functionalities, including surrogate support and text element processing.

member.name: T:System.IO.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespaces contain types that support input and output, including the ability to read and write data to streams either synchronously or asynchronously, to compress data in streams, to create and use isolated stores, to map files to an application's logical address space, to store multiple data objects in a single container, to communicate using anonymous or named pipes, to implement custom logging, and to handle the flow of data to and from serial ports.

member.name: T:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains types that allow the creation and use of isolated stores. With these stores, you can read and write data that less trusted code cannot access and prevent the exposure of sensitive information that can be saved elsewhere on the file system. Data is stored in compartments that are isolated.

member.returns: a string as follows: "storage_ASSEMBLYNAME/fileName"

member.name: M:System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFileStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.param: The buffer to read.

The maximum number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: T:System.Net.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespaces contain classes that provide a simple programming interface for a number of network protocols, programmatically access and update configuration settings for the System.Net namespaces, define cache policies for web resources, compose and send e-mail, represent Multipurpose Internet Mail Exchange (MIME) headers, access network traffic data and network address information, and access peer-to-peer networking functionality. Additional child namespaces provide a managed implementation of the Windows Sockets (Winsock) interface and provide access to network streams for secure communications between hosts.

member.name: T:System.Net.Security.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace provides network streams for secure communications between hosts.

member.name: T:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader
member.summary: The HTTP headers that may be specified in a client request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.CacheControl
member.summary: The Cache-Control header, which specifies directives that must be obeyed by all cache control mechanisms along the request/response chain.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Connection
member.summary: The Connection header, which specifies options that are desired for a particular connection.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Date
member.summary: The Date header, which specifies the date and time at which the request originated.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.KeepAlive
member.summary: The Keep-Alive header, which specifies a parameter used into order to maintain a persistent connection.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Pragma
member.summary: The Pragma header, which specifies implementation-specific directives that might apply to any agent along the request/response chain.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Trailer
member.summary: The Trailer header, which specifies the header fields present in the trailer of a message encoded with chunked transfer-coding.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.TransferEncoding
member.summary: The Transfer-Encoding header, which specifies what (if any) type of transformation that has been applied to the message body.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Upgrade
member.summary: The Upgrade header, which specifies additional communications protocols that the client supports.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Via
member.summary: The Via header, which specifies intermediate protocols to be used by gateway and proxy agents.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Warning
member.summary: The Warning header, which specifies additional information about that status or transformation of a message that might not be reflected in the message.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Allow
member.summary: The Allow header, which specifies the set of HTTP methods supported.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.ContentLength
member.summary: The Content-Length header, which specifies the length, in bytes, of the accompanying body data.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.ContentType
member.summary: The Content-Type header, which specifies the MIME type of the accompanying body data.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.ContentEncoding
member.summary: The Content-Encoding header, which specifies the encodings that have been applied to the accompanying body data.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.ContentLanguage
member.summary: The Content-Langauge header, which specifies the natural language(s) of the accompanying body data.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.ContentLocation
member.summary: The Content-Location header, which specifies a URI from which the accompanying body may be obtained.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.ContentMd5
member.summary: The Content-MD5 header, which specifies the MD5 digest of the accompanying body data, for the purpose of providing an end-to-end message integrity check.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.ContentRange
member.summary: The Content-Range header, which specifies where in the full body the accompanying partial body data should be applied.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Expires
member.summary: The Expires header, which specifies the date and time after which the accompanying body data should be considered stale.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.LastModified
member.summary: The Last-Modified header, which specifies the date and time at which the accompanying body data was last modified.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Accept
member.summary: The Accept header, which specifies the MIME types that are acceptable for the response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.AcceptCharset
member.summary: The Accept-Charset header, which specifies the character sets that are acceptable for the response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.AcceptEncoding
member.summary: The Accept-Encoding header, which specifies the content encodings that are acceptable for the response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.AcceptLanguage
member.summary: The Accept-Langauge header, which specifies that natural languages that are preferred for the response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Authorization
member.summary: The Authorization header, which specifies the credentials that the client presents in order to authenticate itself to the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Cookie
member.summary: The Cookie header, which specifies cookie data presented to the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Expect
member.summary: The Expect header, which specifies particular server behaviors that are required by the client.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.From
member.summary: The From header, which specifies an Internet E-mail address for the human user who controls the requesting user agent.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Host
member.summary: The Host header, which specifies the host name and port number of the resource being requested.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.IfMatch
member.summary: The If-Match header, which specifies that the requested operation should be performed only if the client's cached copy of the indicated resource is current.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.IfModifiedSince
member.summary: The If-Modified-Since header, which specifies that the requested operation should be performed only if the requested resource has been modified since the indicated data and time.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.IfNoneMatch
member.summary: The If-None-Match header, which specifies that the requested operation should be performed only if none of client's cached copies of the indicated resources are current.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.IfRange
member.summary: The If-Range header, which specifies that only the specified range of the requested resource should be sent, if the client's cached copy is current.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.IfUnmodifiedSince
member.summary: The If-Unmodified-Since header, which specifies that the requested operation should be performed only if the requested resource has not been modified since the indicated date and time.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.MaxForwards
member.summary: The Max-Forwards header, which specifies an integer indicating the remaining number of times that this request may be forwarded.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.ProxyAuthorization
member.summary: The Proxy-Authorization header, which specifies the credentials that the client presents in order to authenticate itself to a proxy.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Referer
member.summary: The Referer header, which specifies the URI of the resource from which the request URI was obtained.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Range
member.summary: The Range header, which specifies the the sub-range(s) of the response that the client requests be returned in lieu of the entire response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Te
member.summary: The TE header, which specifies the transfer encodings that are acceptable for the response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.Translate
member.summary: The Translate header, a Microsoft extension to the HTTP specification used in conjunction with WebDAV functionality.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.UserAgent
member.summary: The User-Agent header, which specifies information about the client agent.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.CacheControl
member.summary: The Cache-Control header, which specifies caching directives that must be obeyed by all caching mechanisms along the request/response chain.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Connection
member.summary: The Connection header, which specifies options that are desired for a particular connection.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Date
member.summary: The Date header, which specifies the date and time at which the response originated.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.KeepAlive
member.summary: The Keep-Alive header, which specifies a parameter to be used to maintain a persistent connection.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Pragma
member.summary: The Pragma header, which specifies implementation-specific directives that might apply to any agent along the request/response chain.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Trailer
member.summary: The Trailer header, which specifies that the indicated header fields are present in the trailer of a message that is encoded with chunked transfer-coding.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.TransferEncoding
member.summary: The Transfer-Encoding header, which specifies what (if any) type of transformation has been applied to the message body.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Upgrade
member.summary: The Upgrade header, which specifies additional communications protocols that the client supports.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Via
member.summary: The Via header, which specifies intermediate protocols to be used by gateway and proxy agents.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Warning
member.summary: The Warning header, which specifies additional information about that status or transformation of a message that might not be reflected in the message.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Allow
member.summary: The Allow header, which specifies the set of HTTP methods that are supported.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.ContentLength
member.summary: The Content-Length header, which specifies the length, in bytes, of the accompanying body data.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.ContentType
member.summary: The Content-Type header, which specifies the MIME type of the accompanying body data.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.ContentEncoding
member.summary: The Content-Encoding header, which specifies the encodings that have been applied to the accompanying body data.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.ContentLanguage
member.summary: The Content-Langauge header, which specifies the natural language or languages of the accompanying body data.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.ContentLocation
member.summary: The Content-Location header, which specifies a URI from which the accompanying body can be obtained.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.ContentMd5
member.summary: The Content-MD5 header, which specifies the MD5 digest of the accompanying body data, for the purpose of providing an end-to-end message integrity check.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.ContentRange
member.summary: The Range header, which specifies the subrange or subranges of the response that the client requests be returned in lieu of the entire response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Expires
member.summary: The Expires header, which specifies the date and time after which the accompanying body data should be considered stale.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.LastModified
member.summary: The Last-Modified header, which specifies the date and time at which the accompanying body data was last modified.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.AcceptRanges
member.summary: The Accept-Ranges header, which specifies the range that is accepted by the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Age
member.summary: The Age header, which specifies the time, in seconds, since the response was generated by the originating server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.ETag
member.summary: The Etag header, which specifies the current value for the requested variant.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Location
member.summary: The Location header, which specifies a URI to which the client is redirected to obtain the requested resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.ProxyAuthenticate
member.summary: The Proxy-Authenticate header, which specifies that the client must authenticate itself to a proxy.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.RetryAfter
member.summary: The Retry-After header, which specifies a time (in seconds), or a date and time, after which the client can retry its request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Server
member.summary: The Server header, which specifies information about the originating server agent.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.SetCookie
member.summary: The Set-Cookie header, which specifies cookie data that is presented to the client.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.Vary
member.summary: The Vary header, which specifies the request headers that are used to determine whether a cached response is fresh.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpResponseHeader.WwwAuthenticate
member.summary: The WWW-Authenticate header, which specifies that the client must authenticate itself to the server.

member.name: T:System.Net.HttpStatusCode
member.summary: Contains the values of status codes defined for HTTP.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Continue
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 100. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Continue indicates that the client can continue with its request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.SwitchingProtocols
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 101. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.SwitchingProtocols indicates that the protocol version or protocol is being changed.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.OK
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 200. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.OK indicates that the request succeeded and that the requested information is in the response. This is the most common status code to receive.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Created
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 201. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Created indicates that the request resulted in a new resource created before the response was sent.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Accepted
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 202. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Accepted indicates that the request has been accepted for further processing.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NonAuthoritativeInformation
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 203. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NonAuthoritativeInformation indicates that the returned metainformation is from a cached copy instead of the origin server and therefore may be incorrect.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NoContent
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 204. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NoContent indicates that the request has been successfully processed and that the response is intentionally blank.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ResetContent
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 205. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ResetContent indicates that the client should reset (not reload) the current resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PartialContent
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 206. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PartialContent indicates that the response is a partial response as requested by a GET request that includes a byte range.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MultipleChoices
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 300. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MultipleChoices indicates that the requested information has multiple representations. The default action is to treat this status as a redirect and follow the contents of the Location header associated with this response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Ambiguous
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 300. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Ambiguous indicates that the requested information has multiple representations. The default action is to treat this status as a redirect and follow the contents of the Location header associated with this response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MovedPermanently
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 301. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MovedPermanently indicates that the requested information has been moved to the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Moved
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 301. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Moved indicates that the requested information has been moved to the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will use the GET method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Found
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 302. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Found indicates that the requested information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will use the GET method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Redirect
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 302. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Redirect indicates that the requested information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will use the GET method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.SeeOther
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 303. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.SeeOther automatically redirects the client to the URI specified in the Location header as the result of a POST. The request to the resource specified by the Location header will be made with a GET.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RedirectMethod
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 303. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RedirectMethod automatically redirects the client to the URI specified in the Location header as the result of a POST. The request to the resource specified by the Location header will be made with a GET.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotModified
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 304. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotModified indicates that the client's cached copy is up to date. The contents of the resource are not transferred.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UseProxy
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 305. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UseProxy indicates that the request should use the proxy server at the URI specified in the Location header.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unused
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 306. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unused is a proposed extension to the HTTP/1.1 specification that is not fully specified.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RedirectKeepVerb
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 307. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RedirectKeepVerb indicates that the request information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will also use the POST method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.TemporaryRedirect
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 307. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.TemporaryRedirect indicates that the request information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will also use the POST method.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadRequest
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 400. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadRequest indicates that the request could not be understood by the server. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadRequest is sent when no other error is applicable, or if the exact error is unknown or does not have its own error code.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unauthorized
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 401. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unauthorized indicates that the requested resource requires authentication. The WWW-Authenticate header contains the details of how to perform the authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PaymentRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 402. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PaymentRequired is reserved for future use.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Forbidden
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 403. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Forbidden indicates that the server refuses to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotFound
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 404. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotFound indicates that the requested resource does not exist on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 405. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MethodNotAllowed indicates that the request method (POST or GET) is not allowed on the requested resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotAcceptable
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 406. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotAcceptable indicates that the client has indicated with Accept headers that it will not accept any of the available representations of the resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 407. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired indicates that the requested proxy requires authentication. The Proxy-authenticate header contains the details of how to perform the authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 408. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestTimeout indicates that the client did not send a request within the time the server was expecting the request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Conflict
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 409. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Conflict indicates that the request could not be carried out because of a conflict on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Gone
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 410. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Gone indicates that the requested resource is no longer available.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.LengthRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 411. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.LengthRequired indicates that the required Content-length header is missing.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 412. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PreconditionFailed indicates that a condition set for this request failed, and the request cannot be carried out. Conditions are set with conditional request headers like If-Match, If-None-Match, or If-Unmodified-Since.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 413. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestEntityTooLarge indicates that the request is too large for the server to process.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 414. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestUriTooLong indicates that the URI is too long.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 415. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UnsupportedMediaType indicates that the request is an unsupported type.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 416. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable indicates that the range of data requested from the resource cannot be returned, either because the beginning of the range is before the beginning of the resource, or the end of the range is after the end of the resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 417. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ExpectationFailed indicates that an expectation given in an Expect header could not be met by the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UpgradeRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 426. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UpgradeRequired indicates that the client should switch to a different protocol such as TLS/1.0.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.InternalServerError
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 500. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.InternalServerError indicates that a generic error has occurred on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 501. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotImplemented indicates that the server does not support the requested function.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadGateway
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 502. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadGateway indicates that an intermediate proxy server received a bad response from another proxy or the origin server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 503. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ServiceUnavailable indicates that the server is temporarily unavailable, usually due to high load or maintenance.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 504. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.GatewayTimeout indicates that an intermediate proxy server timed out while waiting for a response from another proxy or the origin server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 505. System.Net.HttpStatusCode.HttpVersionNotSupported indicates that the requested HTTP version is not supported by the server.

member.name: T:System.Reflection.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespaces contain types that provide a managed view of loaded types, methods, and fields, and that can dynamically create and invoke types. A child namespace contains types that enable a compiler or other tool to emit metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL).

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace provides functionality for compiler writers who use managed code to specify attributes in metadata that affect the run-time behavior of the common language runtime.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace provides a wide variety of members that support COM interop and platform invoke services. If you are unfamiliar with these services, see Interoperating with Unmanaged Code.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Serialization.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that can be used for serializing and deserializing objects. Serialization is the process of converting an object or a graph of objects into a linear sequence of bytes for either storage or transmission to another location. Deserialization is the process of taking in stored information and recreating objects from it.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer_Serialization.SerializeToXObjects(System.Object,System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Type},System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Runtime.Serialization.TypeInformation,System.String)
member.summary: Serializes the given object.
member.param: The instance of the object to serialize
The type that the serialization should expect (it can be different from the type of the instance if the instance is from a child class of this type)
The types that should be known by the DataContractSerializer to allow serialization.
True if the DataContractSerializer should use the format normally used by the XmlSerializer.
True if the current node we want to Serialize is the Root (it is the object that is put as the parameter when calling DataContractSerializer.SerializeToXXX.
True if the current element is contained inside an Enumerable. It means that we should add a Node that contains the name of the class expected by the Enumerable (I think, this is old stuff for me)
This contains informations on the type that contains the current object; or in the case of the root, on the type expected by the DataContractSerializer
The default namespace that is applied on the node (not sure exactly since it is old stuff for me).
member.returns: A List<XNode> of the nodes for the current element (a list in case of an Enumerable I think).

member.name: T:System.Windows.NamespaceDoc

member.name: T:System.Windows.Controls.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace provides classes to create elements, known as controls, that enable a user to interact with an application. The control classes are at the core of the user's experience with any application because they allow a user to view, select, or enter data or other information.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.NamespaceDoc

member.name: T:System.Windows.Markup.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace provides types to support XAML. Some of these types are located in WPF assemblies and are specific to WPF scenarios that involve XAML. Other types in this namespace provide support for .NET Framework XAML Services in general, and do not require referencing WPF assemblies.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that the Thumb moved a specified distance, as determined by the value of LargeChange. The Thumb moved to the left for a horizontal ScrollBar or upward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that the Thumb moved a specified distance, as determined by the value of LargeChange. The Thumb moved to the right for a horizontal ScrollBar or downward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.ThumbTrack
member.summary: The Thumb was dragged and caused a PointerMoved event. A Scroll event of this ScrollEventType may occur more than one time when the Thumb is dragged in the ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.EndScroll

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ContextMenuService.SetContextMenu(Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject,Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ContextMenu)
member.summary: Sets the ContextMenu property on the specified object.
member.param: The object on which to set the ContextMenu property.

The value of the ContextMenu property. If the value is of type ContextMenu, then that is the ContextMenu that will be used (without any modification). If the value is of any other type, then that value will be used as the content for a ContextMenu provided by this service, and the other attached properties of this service will be used to configure the ContextMenu.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility
member.summary: Specifies the visibility of a scrollbar within a ScrollViewer control.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Disabled
member.summary: [DOESN'T WORK YET, BEHAVES LIKE Hidden] A ScrollBar does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. The dimension of the content is set to the corresponding dimension of the ScrollViewer parent. For a horizontal ScrollBar, the width of the content is set to the ViewportWidth of the ScrollViewer. For a vertical ScrollBar, the height of the content is set to the ViewportHeight of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Auto
member.summary: A ScrollBar appears and the dimension of the ScrollViewer is applied to the content when the viewport cannot display all of the content. For a horizontal ScrollBar, the width of the content is set to the ViewportWidth of the ScrollViewer. For a vertical ScrollBar, the height of the content is set to the ViewportHeight of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Hidden
member.summary: A ScrollBar does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. The dimension of the ScrollViewer is not applied to the content.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Visible
member.summary: A ScrollBar always appears. The dimension of the ScrollViewer is applied to the content. For a horizontal ScrollBar, the width of the content is set to the ViewportWidth of the ScrollViewer. For a vertical ScrollBar, the height of the content is set to the ViewportHeight of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollMode

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollMode.Disabled
member.summary: Scrolling is disabled.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollMode.Enabled
member.summary: Scrolling is enabled.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollMode.Auto
member.summary: Scrolling is enabled but behavior uses a "rails" manipulation mode.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) source of the HTML content to display in the control inside an iframe. member.summary: Gets or sets the converter object that is called by the binding engine to modify the data as it is passed between the source and target, or vice versa. Returns the IValueConverter object that modifies the data.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.ConverterLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that names the language to pass to any converter specified by the Converter property. Returns a string that names a language. Interpretation of this value is ultimately up to the converter logic.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.ConverterParameter
member.summary: Gets or sets a parameter that can be used in the Converter logic. Returns a parameter to be passed to the Converter. This can be used in the conversion logic. The default is null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the element to use as the binding source for the Binding. Returns the value of the Name property or x:Name attribute for the element to bind to. The default is null.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the direction of the data flow in the binding. Returns one of the BindingMode values.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the binding source property. Returns the property path for the source of the binding.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.RelativeSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding source by specifying its location relative to the position of the binding target. Returns the relative location of the binding source to use. The default is null.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source for the binding. Returns the source object that contains the data for the binding.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.UpdateSourceTrigger
member.summary: Update type

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.TemplateOwner
member.summary: Do not use this property.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.ValidatesOnExceptions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the binding engine will report exception validation errors.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.NotifyOnValidationError
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the System.Windows.FrameworkElement.BindingValidationError event is raised on validation errors.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.ValidatesOnLoad
member.summary: True to force the property to go through the Validation process when the Binding is set or when the Target is added in the Visual tree. This way, if the source property has an Invalid value when setting the Binding, it will immediately be marked as Invalid instead of waiting for a value change that keeps/makes it Invalid (which is what happens on Silverlight). Defaults to False since it is the behaviour of Silverlight and WPF.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that describes the location of the binding source relative to the position of the binding target. Returns a value of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.RelativeSource.AncestorLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of ancestor to look for, in System.Windows.Data.RelativeSourceMode.FindAncestor mode. Use 1 to indicate the one nearest to the binding target element.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.RelativeSource.AncestorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of ancestor to look for.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.RelativeSourceMode
member.summary: Defines constants that describe the location of the binding source relative to the position of the binding target.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.RelativeSourceMode.None
member.summary: Don't use this value of RelativeSourceMode; always use either Self or TemplatedParent.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.RelativeSourceMode.TemplatedParent
member.summary: Refers to the element to which the template (in which the data-bound element exists) is applied. This is similar to setting a TemplateBinding Markup Extension and is only applicable if the Binding is within a template.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.RelativeSourceMode.Self
member.summary: Refers to the element on which you are setting the binding and allows you to bind one property of that element to another property on the same element.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.RelativeSourceMode.FindAncestor
member.summary: Refers to the ancestor in the parent chain of the data-bound element. You can use this to bind to an ancestor of a specific type or its subclasses. This is the mode you use if you want to specify System.Windows.Data.RelativeSource.AncestorType and/or System.Windows.Data.RelativeSource.AncestorLevel.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Data.StandardPropertyPathNode.#ctor

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetCurrentPoint(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Returns the pointer position for this event occurrence, optionally evaluated against a coordinate origin of a supplied UIElement.
member.param: Any UIElement-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overall coordinate system, use a relativeTo value of null.
member.returns: A PointerPoint value that represents the pointer point associated with this event. If null was passed as relativeTo, the coordinates are in the frame of reference of the overall window. If a non-null relativeTo was passed, the coordinates are relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.

member.summary: The coordinate system is not relative to a bounding box. Values are interpreted directly in local space.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox
member.summary: The coordinate system is relative to a bounding box: 0 indicates 0 percent of the bounding box, and 1 indicates 100 percent of the bounding box. For example, (0.5, 0.5) describes a point in the middle of the bounding box, and (1, 1) describes a point at the bottom right of the bounding box.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule
member.summary: Specifies how the intersecting areas of PathFigure objects contained in a Geometry are combined to form the area of the Geometry.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments within the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.Nonzero
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region of the path by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path. Otherwise, it is inside.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AddHandler(Windows.UI.Xaml.RoutedEvent,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a routed event handler for a specified routed event, adding the handler to the handler collection on the current element. Specify handledEventsToo as true to have the provided handler be invoked for a routed event case that had already been marked as handled by another element along the event route.
member.param: An identifier for the routed event to be handled.
A reference to the handler implementation.

True to register the handler such that it is invoked even when the routed event is marked handled in its event data. False to register the handler with the default condition that it will not be invoked if the routed event is already marked handled. The default is false.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.RemoveHandler(Windows.UI.Xaml.RoutedEvent,System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the specified routed event handler from this UIElement. Typically the handler in question was added by AddHandler.
member.param: The identifier of the routed event for which the handler is attached.
The specific handler implementation to remove from the event handler collection on this UIElement.

member.name: T:Windows.Foundation.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace enables fundamental Windows Runtime functionality, including managing asynchronous operations and accessing property stores. This namespace also defines common value types that represent Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs), dates and times, 2-D measurements, and other basic values.

member.name: T:Windows.Foundation.Point
member.summary: Represents an x- and y-coordinate pair in two-dimensional space. Can also represent a logical point for certain property usages.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Point.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a Windows.Foundation.Point structure that contains the specified values.
member.param: The x-coordinate value of the Windows.Foundation.Point structure.
The y-coordinate value of the Windows.Foundation.Point structure.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Point.op_Inequality(Windows.Foundation.Point,Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Compares two Windows.Foundation.Point structures for inequality
member.param: The first point to compare.
The second point to compare.
member.returns: true if point1 and point2 have different Windows.Foundation.Point.X or Windows.Foundation.Point.Y values; false if point1 and point2 have the same Windows.Foundation.Point.X and Windows.Foundation.Point.Y values.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Point.op_Equality(Windows.Foundation.Point,Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Compares two Windows.Foundation.Point structures for equality
member.param: The first point to compare.
The second point to compare.
member.returns: true if both the Windows.Foundation.Point.X and Windows.Foundation.Point.Y values of point1 and point2 are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Point.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the Windows.Foundation.Point.X-coordinate value of this Windows.Foundation.Point structure.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Point.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Windows.Foundation.Point.Y-coordinate value of this Windows.Foundation.Point.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Point.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is a Windows.Foundation.Point and whether it contains the same values as this Windows.Foundation.Point.
member.param: The object to compare.
member.returns: true if obj is a Windows.Foundation.Point and contains the same Windows.Foundation.Point.X and Windows.Foundation.Point.Y values as this Windows.Foundation.Point; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Point.Equals(Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Compares two Windows.Foundation.Point structures for equality.
member.param: The point to compare to this instance.
member.returns: true if both Windows.Foundation.Point structures contain the same Windows.Foundation.Point.X and Windows.Foundation.Point.Y values; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Point.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this Windows.Foundation.Point.
member.returns: The hash code for this Windows.Foundation.Point.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Point.ToString
member.summary: Creates a System.String representation of this Windows.Foundation.Point.
member.returns: A System.String containing the Windows.Foundation.Point.X and Windows.Foundation.Point.Y values of this Windows.Foundation.Point structure.

member.name: T:Windows.Foundation.Rect
member.summary: Describes the width, height, and point origin of a rectangle.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.#ctor(Windows.Foundation.Point,Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Initializes a Windows.Foundation.Rect structure that is exactly large enough to contain the two specified points.
member.param: The first point that the new rectangle must contain.
The second point that the new rectangle must contain.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.#ctor(Windows.Foundation.Point,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Initializes a Windows.Foundation.Rect structure based on an origin and size.
member.param: The origin of the new Windows.Foundation.Rect.
The size of the new Windows.Foundation.Rect.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a Windows.Foundation.Rect structure that has the specified x-coordinate, y-coordinate, width, and height.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The width of the rectangle.
The height of the rectangle.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.op_Inequality(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Compares two Windows.Foundation.Rect structures for inequality.
member.param: The first rectangle to compare.
The second rectangle to compare.
member.returns: true if the Windows.Foundation.Rect structures do not have the same x,y,width,height property values; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.op_Equality(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Compares two Windows.Foundation.Rect structures for equality.
member.param: The first rectangle to compare.
The second rectangle to compare.
member.returns: true if the Windows.Foundation.Rect structures have the same x,y,width,height property values; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Bottom
member.summary: Gets the y-axis value of the bottom of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Empty
member.summary: Gets a special value that represents a rectangle with no position or area.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the rectangle is the Windows.Foundation.Rect.Empty rectangle.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Left
member.summary: Gets the x-axis value of the left side of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Right
member.summary: Gets the x-axis value of the right side of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Top
member.summary: Gets the y-axis position of the top of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-axis value of the left side of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-axis value of the top side of the rectangle.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Contains(Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Indicates whether the rectangle described by the Windows.Foundation.Rect contains the specified point.
member.param: The point to check.
member.returns: true if the rectangle described by the Windows.Foundation.Rect contains the specified point; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified object is equal to the current Windows.Foundation.Rect.
member.param: The object to compare to the current rectangle.
member.returns: true if o is a Windows.Foundation.Rect and has the same x,y,width,height values as the current Windows.Foundation.Rect; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Equals(Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified Windows.Foundation.Rect is equal to the current Windows.Foundation.Rect.
member.param: The rectangle to compare to the current rectangle.
member.returns: true if the specified Windows.Foundation.Rect has the same x,y,width,height property values as the current Windows.Foundation.Rect; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.GetHashCode
member.summary: Creates a hash code for the Windows.Foundation.Rect.
member.returns: A hash code for the current Windows.Foundation.Rect structure.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the Windows.Foundation.Rect structure.
member.returns: A string representation of the current Windows.Foundation.Rect structure. The string has the following form: "Windows.Foundation.Rect.X,Windows.Foundation.Rect.Y,Windows.Foundation.Rect.Width,Windows.Foundation.Rect.Height".

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Union(Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Expands the rectangle represented by the current Windows.Foundation.Rect exactly enough to contain the specified point.
member.param: The point to include.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Rect.Union(Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Expands the rectangle represented by the current Windows.Foundation.Rect exactly enough to contain the specified rectangle.
member.param: The rectangle to include.

member.name: T:Windows.Foundation.Size

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Windows.Foundation.Size structure and assigns it an initial width and height.

The initial height of the instance of Windows.Foundation.Size.

member.summary: Compares two instances of Windows.Foundation.Size for inequality.

member.summary: Compares two instances of Windows.Foundation.Size for equality.
member.param: The first instance of Windows.Foundation.Size to compare.
The second instance of Windows.Foundation.Size to compare.
member.returns: true if the two instances of Windows.Foundation.Size are equal; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Size.Empty
member.summary: Gets a value that represents a static empty Windows.Foundation.Size.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Size.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of this instance of Windows.Foundation.Size in pixels. The default is 0. The value cannot be negative.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Size.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this instance of Windows.Foundation.Size is Windows.Foundation.Size.Empty.

member.name: P:Windows.Foundation.Size.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of this instance of Windows.Foundation.Size.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Size.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares an object to an instance of Windows.Foundation.Size for equality.
member.param: The System.Object to compare.
member.returns: true if the sizes are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Size.Equals(Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Compares a value to an instance of Windows.Foundation.Size for equality.
member.param: The size to compare to this current instance of Windows.Foundation.Size.
member.returns: true if the instances of Windows.Foundation.Size are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Size.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets the hash code for this instance of Windows.Foundation.Size.
member.returns: The hash code for this instance of Windows.Foundation.Size.

member.name: M:Windows.Foundation.Size.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this Windows.Foundation.Size.
member.returns: A string representation of this Windows.Foundation.Size.

member.name: T:DotNetForHtml5.Core.TypeFromStringConverters
member.summary: A class used to convert elements written as strings in the XAML code into the correct type for the properties setted

member.name: M:DotNetForHtml5.Core.TypeFromStringConverters.CanTypeBeConverted(System.Type)
member.summary: Checks if it is possible to convert from string to a given type.
member.param: Type to lookup.
member.returns: True if a converter exists, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DotNetForHtml5.Core.TypeFromStringConverters.RegisterConverter(System.Type,System.Func{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Registers a type and its associated method to convert it from a string. This method takes part in allowing the definition of an object of the said type directly in the xaml.
member.param: The type for which a converter will be defined
The method that will convert the XAML string into an instance of the type.

member.name: M:DotNetForHtml5.Core.TypeFromStringConverters.ConvertFromInvariantString(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the given string into the specified Type using the registered converter for the Type.
member.param: The Type to which the conversion method is registered.
The string to convert.
member.returns: The instance of the specified type converted from the string.

member.name: M:DotNetForHtml5.Core.INTERNAL_PopupsManager.IsPopupParentVisibleOnScreen(Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Popup)
member.summary: Determines whether the parent of a popup is visible on screen, and if it is the foremost element (ie. not covered by another element). This is useful for example to hide the TextBox validation tooltips when they become hidden after scrolling (cf. ZenDesk 628).
member.param: The popup.
member.returns: Returns True if the parent of the popup is visible on screen and it is the foremost element, False otherwise.

member.name: M:DotNetForHtml5.Core.INTERNAL_PopupsManager.IsElementVisibleOnScreen(Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Determines whether an element is visible on screen, and if it is the foremost element (ie. it is not covered by another element). This is useful for example to hide the TextBox validation tooltips when they become hidden after scrolling (cf. ZenDesk 628).
member.param: The element to check.
member.returns: Returns True if the element is visible on screen and it is the foremost element, False otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespaces provide types that handle events raised by the operating system, that manipulate the system registry, and that represent file and operating system handles.

member.returns: The DOM element corresponding to the UIElement. It is the DOM Element that contains all of the UIElement's DOM elements.

member.name: M:CSharpXamlForHtml5.DomManagement.SetHtmlRepresentation(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the Html representation of the UIElement.

The string that defines the html representation of the UIElement.

member.name: P:CSharpXamlForHtml5.Environment.IsRunningInJavaScript

member.name: T:OperationFormatStyle
member.summary: Represents the SOAP style that determines how the WSDL metadata for the service is formatted.

member.name: F:OperationFormatStyle.Document
member.summary: Causes the WSDL representation to contain a single element that represents the document that is exchanged for the operation.

member.name: F:OperationFormatStyle.Rpc
member.summary: Causes the WSDL representation of messages exchanged for an operation and contains parameters as if it were a remote procedure call.
